meanings.definition: To manipulate or adjust in a dishonest way
meanings.sent1: He fudges the numbers to make it seem like he's doing better than he really is.
meanings.sent2: She always fudges the truth to avoid getting into trouble.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox fudges its way out of tricky situations.
meanings.sent4: Her smile fudges the true feelings she has inside.
meanings.sent5: The magician fudges the trick to deceive the audience.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his fudges; he's just making up stories.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was full of political fudges that didn't lead to any solutions.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's fudges had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were just fudges to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The child's fudges about monsters under the bed scared his little sister.

meanings.definition: A type of candy made from sugar, butter, and milk
meanings.sent1: She bought a box of fudges to enjoy during the movie.
meanings.sent2: The store sells various flavors of fudges, including chocolate and vanilla.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's homemade fudges are always a hit at family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The sweet aroma of fudges filled the kitchen as they cooled on the counter.
meanings.sent5: The kids eagerly lined up to get a taste of the freshly made fudges.
